meanings.definition: An alloy of copper and zinc resembling gold.
meanings.sent1: The jewelry was made of pinchbeck, giving it a shiny appearance.
meanings.sent2: She admired the pinchbeck necklace, thinking it was real gold.
meanings.sent3: The thief tried to sell the pinchbeck ring as pure gold, but was caught.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as fake as pinchbeck, hiding his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The pinchbeck coins sparkled in the sunlight, fooling many into thinking they were valuable.

meanings.sent1: The pinchbeck watch stopped working after a few days.
meanings.sent2: He wore a pinchbeck crown to the costume party, pretending to be a king.
meanings.sent3: The pinchbeck painting fooled everyone at first glance.
meanings.sent4: Her pinchbeck smile didn't reach her eyes, revealing her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The pinchbeck diamond ring looked real, but it was just a clever imitation.
